result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvester R Aldridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING OCTOBER 30, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: $1,537.46 to Irvin P.  Court ordered:   bail transfered from 15CF1585 to apply to restitution; and defendant to pay minimum of $50.00 per month toward restitution.

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, restitution and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid during period of probation.  If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.  All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant:   of penalties for violation of No Contact Order; and due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with 2218 S. 15 Street, Milwaukee, or victims P.H. or P. B.  
No violent contact with Adriana J. or her minor children without approval of the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention program.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determned by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review hrg.
*10/30/2015  STAY LIFTED as to 90 days.  Huber release if working for work.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; Huber release if working, for work. the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
No other court dates scheduled.
Bail Refund Packets

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Reviewed by the court, Restitution Worksheet. Parties stipulated on the record to Restitution. Court reviewed and returned photographs to the state. Statement from victim.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Court ordered 6 MONTHS of condition time, STAYED pending review hearing.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with 2218 S. 15th Street Milwaukee, or victims P.H. or P.B., no violent contact with Adriana J. or her minor children without approval of the court. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Pay restitution in the amount of $1537.46 to Irvin P., court ordered bail transfered from 15CF1585 and to apply to restitution. Court ordered defendant to pay a minimum of $50.00 per month toward restitution.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Attorney Klimetz contacted the court to request Plea & Sentencing date be adjourned to 1:30 PM from 8:30 AM on 6/25/2015. ADA Lindsay consented. Case adjourned to 1:30 PM.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Sylvester R Aldridge not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.   Judge Grady has accepted this case for global resolution before Branch 23; case transferred to Branch 23.  Case set for Plea and Sentencing on 6-25-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 23.
Justice Point Discharge Summary report, received and filed.
Case is set or Plea & Sentencing date at request of parties in branch 23 for global resolution. Case set for 6/25/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.
Parties request transfer to Branch 23 for global resolution.  This Court has no objection to this matter being resolved before Branch 23 upon acceptance.

Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Defense to notify public defender of the need for new counsel.  Status of counsel date scheduled before Branch 21.  Defendant to be produced on next date.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Justice Point Status Update, received and filed.
*defendant in custody*
Justice Point VIOLATION REPORT, received and filed.

Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference. 
Defense needs time to review offer provided on today; request for status date granted.

  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Derek Waterstreet practicing under the student practice rule under the supervision of Sarah McNutt for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Bradley Blum. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/16/15.
HMP
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court.  Attorney Dietzler called the Court at approximately 8:10am to inform the Court that he would not be able to appear due to medical issues. Ron Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/4/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Irvin PB or Miguel PH

Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Sylvester R Aldridge in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIED motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
